definition:
Many authors tried to formalize the notation of a graph. This problem is
relatively simple if we allow at most $1$ edge between vertices. But for
multigraphs, i.e. graphs with many edges (possibly infinitely many)
between vertices this tends to be problematic formally. We wish to give
an alternative definition, which uses so called .

**Definition.** A **multigraph** or **non-oriented graph** is a triple
$$G=(V,E,\tau)$$ where $V$ is a nonempty set whose elements are called
vertices, $E$ is a set whose elements are called edges and
$$\tau:E\to V^2_{sym}$$ is a function which takes every edge to a pair
of vertices called ends of this edge. On the right side we have a of $V$
to ensure that the order of ends is not important.

This definition allows loops and even infinite number of edges between
two vertices and is one of the most general and formal.
